concise_definition: n. 拍卖, 拍卖会; v. 拍卖

definitions.explanation_en: A public sale in which goods or property are sold to the highest bidder, typically through competitive bidding in a structured process.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一种公开销售活动，商品或财产通过竞标方式出售给出价最高者，通常遵循有组织的竞价流程。
definitions.example_en: The antique furniture will be auctioned off next Saturday at the town hall.
definitions.example_cn: 这些古董家具将于下周六在市政厅进行拍卖。

definitions.explanation_en: To sell something at an auction, especially by inviting and accepting competitive bids from interested parties.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过拍卖方式出售某物，尤其是通过邀请并接受相关方的竞标来完成交易。
definitions.example_en: The estate was auctioned after the owner passed away, raising over $2 million.
definitions.example_cn: 主人去世后，其遗产被拍卖，筹得超过200万美元。

definitions.explanation_en: The process or system of bidding in which prices are determined by competitive offers, often used metaphorically to describe any competitive allocation process.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过竞争性出价来决定价格的过程或制度，也可用于比喻任何通过竞争分配资源的方式。
definitions.example_en: The company held an auction for the contract, and the lowest bid won.
definitions.example_cn: 公司为该合同举行了竞标，出价最低者中标。

comparison.analysis: “Sale”（销售）泛指任何商品的出售行为，可以是固定价格、打折或批发，不涉及竞争性出价。而 “auction” 特指通过竞价决定最终价格的销售方式，强调买方之间的竞争和价格动态上升。
“Bid”（出价）是拍卖过程中的一个动作或行为，指买方提出的报价。它本身不是一种销售机制，而是 “auction” 的组成部分。可以说 ‘place a bid’，但不能说 ‘place an auction’。
“Lot”（拍品）是拍卖会上被出售的单件物品或一组物品，是拍卖的对象。而 “auction” 是整个活动或过程。例如：‘The lot included three paintings’，但 ‘The auction lasted three hours’。两者是内容与形式的关系。
